title: There are 2 ways for the to operate in manual mode. They are…
caption_en: There are 2 ways for the to operate in manual mode. They are, -MANUAL PRESS switch selection or - automatically after a dual ADC failure. oo _

title: Manual Press Switch Selection The MANUAL PRESS switch is bla…
caption_en: Manual Press Switch Selection The MANUAL PRESS switch is blank during the Automatic mode control. When manually selected, the ON light illuminates to indicate manual operation of the An advisory CAS message CAB PRESS MAN is also displayed. J oo _

title: The MANUAL rate knob is used to control the cabin rate of cl…
caption_en: The MANUAL rate knob is used to control the cabin rate of climb or descent at increments of fpm up to a limit of fpm. In the manual mode, the landing altitude knob ALT) has no effect on the pressurization system. J oo _

title: Let us assume that the current cabin rate of climb is fymin.…
caption_en: Let us assume that the current cabin rate of climb is fymin. When the MANUAL DN-UP knob is rotated for a ftmin climb, MR (manual rate) appears on the CAB RATE line. Five seconds later, after the last movement of the MANUAL rate knob, the display reverts to the current cabin rate. J oo _

title: On the ECS page, appears on the MANUAL RATE line. Next, the …
caption_en: On the ECS page, appears on the MANUAL RATE line. Next, the cabin rate increases to the selected manual rate. When the desired cabin altitude is approached, the manual rate knob must be rotated in the opposite direction until the manual cabin rate reaches zero. I oo _

title: Automatic Activation Manual operation is automatically selec…
caption_en: Automatic Activation Manual operation is automatically selected when there is a loss of both ADC signals to the This has already been described under the dual ADC failure in the Automatic mode section. Note that an automatic activation will resultin a caution CAS message CAB PRESS MAN being displayed. oo _
